name: Ghamidi Center of Islamic Learning
mission: The sole purpose of our existence is to educate people about moral, ethical, and human values as taught in Islam. We aim to separate history and culture from religion and teach it in its purest form as a field of study rather than as a creed. Our teaching method uses common sense, argument, and logic, and we highly value critical thinking over the blind following.
theoryOfChange: By teaching Islam as a field of study based on reason and the Quran/Sunnah (Tazkiyah al-Nafs), the organization aims to purify individual and collective human life from defilements and cultural accretions.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://ghamidicenter.com/donate (Source: https://ghamidicenter.com/donate)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.improvement_suggestion: Clarify zakat allocation policy and eligible use categories for donors.
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 25/50: MEDIUM Muslim donor fit, education global cause area

score_details.score_summary: AL-Mawrid United States Inc shows good impact and moderate alignment, with zakat compliance.

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://ghamidicenter.com/donate (Source: https://ghamidicenter.com/donate)

all_citations.claim: Al-Mawrid United States Inc holds a Charity Navigator score of 84.5/100 and focuses on educational programming.
The organization is zakat-eligible and provides specific policies for zakat distribution.
In 2023, the charity reported total revenue of $816,038, a program expense ratio of 75.2%, 10.9 months of working capital, and fundraising efficiency of $0.11 per $1 raised.
The charity offers multiple donation options and methods for supporters to contribute to its mission.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a moderate overall score due to its solid financial health and efficient fundraising, balanced by a need for more direct evidence of program impact.
areas_for_improvement: Enhancing impact measurement and reporting to improve the overall impact score.
Increasing transparency and third-party verification to boost data confidence and alignment metrics.

dimension_explanations.alignment: The charity shows medium alignment for Muslim donors seeking an intellectual and rationalist approach to faith, and its zakat-eligible status provides a clear path for religious giving [2][4]. The focus on global education addresses a significant need for accessible Islamic scholarship [1].
dimension_explanations.impact: Al-Mawrid demonstrates moderate impact through its capacity-building initiatives and educational programs, maintaining a Charity Navigator score of 84.5/100 [1]. With total revenue of $816,038 and a program expense ratio of 75.2%, the charity focuses its resources on content creation and global education [3].

baseline_narrative.headline: Al-Mawrid United States Inc promotes a rational and objective approach to understanding Islam through education and global outreach.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 75.2%, indicating a strong commitment to direct mission-related activities.
Excellent fundraising efficiency, spending only $0.11 to raise every $1.
Robust liquidity with 10.9 months of working capital available.
baseline_narrative.summary: Al-Mawrid United States Inc is a non-profit organization dedicated to teaching Islamic principles based on reason and rationality through its Education Program, AskGhamidi platform, and translation services [1][3]. The organization is recognized as zakat-eligible, allowing donors to fulfill their religious obligations through various giving methods [2][4].

all_citations.claim: overall score of 84.84.5/100 from Charity Navigator

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a moderate overall score due to its solid financial health and efficient fundraising, balanced by a need for more direct evidence of program impact.

areas_for_improvement.context: The organization currently operates with a <cite id="1">minimal board size of 3 members</cite>, which limits diverse oversight compared to larger institutions.
While <cite id="2">zakat-eligible</cite>, the charity could improve alignment by <cite id="2">clarifying specific allocation policies</cite> for different asnaf categories.

bbb_assessment.summary: The organization has not yet been fully reviewed against the 20 BBB Standards for Charity Accountability.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization maintains high transparency and a strong working capital ratio to offset governance risks.
risk_factors: <cite id="1">Small board size (3 members)</cite> may limit organizational oversight
<cite id="1">High cost per beneficiary ($1715.80)</cite> compared to basic education peers
case_against.summary: The primary concerns involve <cite id="1">governance limitations</cite> and high delivery costs.

confidence.notes: Strong transparency with Platinum Candid seal

alignment.explanation: Strong fit for donors seeking intellectual Islamic discourse with <cite id="2">verified zakat eligibility</cite> under the fisabilillah category.
alignment.improvement: Alignment could be improved by <cite id="2">clarifying zakat allocation policies</cite> and eligible use categories for donors.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust this charity due to its <cite id="1">Platinum Seal of Transparency</cite> and <cite id="1">100% independent board</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the charity should consider expanding its <cite id="1">board size beyond 3 members</cite> to enhance governance diversity.

impact.explanation: Operations are efficient with an <cite id="3">75.2% program expense ratio</cite>, though the <cite id="1">cost per beneficiary is high at $1715.80</cite> due to the intensive nature of scholarly research.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="1">expanding services to underserved geographies</cite> to lower the relative cost per person reached.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Verified outcomes through Candid

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Does not operate as a significant grantmaker

rich_narrative.headline: Al-Mawrid United States Inc promotes a rational and objective approach to understanding Islam through education and global outreach.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who value a rationalist, research-based approach to Islam and want to support global religious literacy through zakat-eligible scholarly work.
donor_motivations: Want to support the evolution of Islamic religious thought
Value high transparency and Platinum-level data disclosure
Prefer funding intellectual capacity building over direct relief
Seek to fulfill zakat through the fisabilillah category
giving_considerations: The organization is small with a 3-year revenue CAGR of -0.1%
High cost per beneficiary reflects the scholarly nature of the work
Strong reserves mean the organization is financially stable but not rapidly expanding
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking immediate humanitarian relief or those who prefer organizations with large, diverse governing boards.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects that while the charity tracks <cite id="1">5 outcome metrics</cite> and has <cite id="1">1 external evaluation document</cite>, it lacks large-scale independent RCTs.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Al-Mawrid aims to revisit and evolve religious thought through research and an educational environment where Islam is taught as a foundation for reason.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that scholarly translations and classes are effectively reaching and educating the intended global audience.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a <cite id="3">revenue CAGR of -0.1%</cite>, the organization has reached a plateau and requires additional funding to expand its reach.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by a <cite id="1">fundraising efficiency of $0.11 per $1</cite>, which is superior to many peers.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar focus on religious services and size
similar_organizations.name: American Imam Academy

strengths.detail: The organization demonstrates high fiscal responsibility, spending only <cite id="1">$0.11 to raise every $1</cite> and maintaining a <cite id="3">program expense ratio of 75.2%</cite>.
Al-Mawrid maintains <cite id="1">10.9 months of working capital</cite> in working capital, providing significant resilience against funding fluctuations.
The charity has earned the <cite id="1">Platinum Seal of Transparency</cite>, the highest level of recognition for data disclosure from Candid.

strengths_deep_dive: Al-Mawrid's financial health is anchored by its ability to maintain <cite id="1">100% independent board members</cite>, ensuring objective oversight of its <cite id="3">$816,038 in annual revenue</cite>. The organization’s commitment to its mission is evidenced by its <cite id="3">$704,499 in direct contributions</cite> being largely funneled into its educational platforms, such as AskGhamidi and its translation services. Furthermore, the organization has demonstrated strategic clarity by <cite id="1">tracking 5 distinct outcome metrics</cite> through Candid, which is rare for religious organizations of this scale.
rich_narrative.summary: Al-Mawrid United States Inc, also known as the Ghamidi Center of Islamic Learning, is a religious and educational institution <cite id="1">founded in 2014</cite> that promotes a rationalist approach to Islamic thought. The organization operates on a global scale, providing <cite id="3">educational classes, Sunday schools, and discussion groups</cite> designed to foster objective understanding of faith. With <cite id="3">total revenue of $816,038</cite> in 2023, the charity maintains a lean operational structure, directing a <cite id="3">program expense ratio of 75.2%</cite> toward its core mission of translation, research, and teaching. The organization is <cite id="2">zakat-eligible</cite>, specifically identifying its work under the category of <cite id="2">fisabilillah</cite> (in the way of Allah) to support religious education and outreach. Despite its relatively small size, it has achieved a <cite id="1">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>, reflecting a high level of voluntary data sharing regarding its goals and results.
